Explanations about Options.--addmode(C): The final step is to add the new resolution to the VGA1: "sudo xrandr --addmode VGA1 1366x768_60.00".
Explanations about Options.--addmode(M):
output name
 Add a mode to the set of valid modes for an output.
Explanations about Options.--mode(M): This selects a mode. Use either the name or the XID for mode
Explanations about Options.--output(M): Selects an output to reconfigure. Use either the name of the output or the XID.
Explanations about Options.--rate(M): This sets the refresh rate closest to the specified value.
Explanations about Options.-s(C): Then you just user xrandr -s to change the screen resolution mode.
Explanations about Options.-s(M):
This sets the screen size, either matching by size or using the index into the list
 of available sizes.
